Key Match Events: Edgardo Henriquez made his MLB debut by giving up one hit and striking out two, including Fernando Tatis Jr. with a 101-mph fastball, in a scoreless seventh inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts said the chances of Clayton Kershaw facing hitters this week are unlikely.
Roberts didn't rule out carrying a rookie with minimal big-league experience on their postseason roster.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Veteran shortstop Miguel Rojas was named the winner of the 19th annual Roy Campanella Award.
The Dodgers called up right-handed pitching prospect Edgardo Henriquez for Tuesday's game.
Others: Clayton Kershaw's toe injury and the Dodgers' injury-ravaged rotation are major concerns for the team's postseason chances.
